turns.text: Okay

turns.text: Oh I think I think that womans role has come long way We have gone more into the business aspect of like I say of I dont know working more and we I think weve even gone into more the labor aspect of it also

turns.text: Yeah definitely
turns.label: aa

turns.text: With the pay and everything you know
I feel that uh weve missed as far as the top jobs go
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: You know the higher echelon
uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: There may be few but very incidental
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah

turns.text: And I really think that it will be long time probably before we see that In one sense Im an older person in my fifties so I feel that weve lost some things in the sense that women have to work today

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: You know that they are not in the home by choice anymore
uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.label: sv

turns.text: And lot of times you cant yeah
turns.label: ba

turns.text: You know its gotten to be two income family to just survive today between taxes and the cost of living and I dont think raises have kept up with you know lot of the stuff you know as far as your medical insurance and just groceries and gasoline and all you know
turns.label: sv

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: So I think that we did come long way in the sense that we are allowed to vote in you know like you say were out in the labor force but I think weve lost something too
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah my mom shes housewife and well there is twelve kids in my family so my mom never could really work you know because she was kind of pregnant from day one She never really had chance to work
turns.label: b

turns.text: Yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: She worked before she got married but uh she uh she doesnt believe in - shes very old fashioned She doesnt believe in the woman working unless she has to
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Thats what I mean and --
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- you know theres lot of truth to that If you are not going to have family then thats fine then you know career is smart choice
uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And I think its great but if you you have family I think you owe the family responsibility
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And to have children and just get day care or someone to take care of it and not really have the bonding process that takes place with babies and stuff you know --
turns.label: sv

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- I I think that the mother and the child lose and I think thats why there is so many problems --
Yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: -- you know with kids today because they dont have the family roots anymore You know Im not saying that that its totally gone but its nothing like what it used to be
Yeah uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: You know in that sense

Yeah and also like my mom my mom thinks - I mean shes kind of right with it when both partners of the marriage work she feels that thats taking more away thats increasing more unemployment for people that need to work
turns.label: b

turns.text: Oh definitely
turns.label: aa

turns.text: You know like for for the men that dont have jobs if you know she feels if there is women out there just because they want to do it she said you know they could stay at home

Yeah

turns.label: qo

turns.text: Thats fine thats thats the freedom of choice

turns.text: uh-huh

turns.text: And I agree with that because anyone who has children that doesnt really want them isnt going to be good parent

turns.label: sv

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: Im not sorry I had any of them and I worked third shift for good part of my life just so I would be home with them
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: You know I had to work but I tried to make it as painless as possible
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: In fact at one time I worked as second shift and one Saturday morning we were all sitting at the breakfast table and the kids were talking daddy this daddy that daddy this daddy that and I was sitting there It was like I didnt belong anymore And it was because I had worked for about nine months and when they were coming home I was going to work
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And I wasnt there at supper time or bed time or they couldnt tell me what went on at school because they would be coming in the door I would be going out
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Exactly
turns.label: aa

turns.text: So we were I felt I was losing my family
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And thats why I said thats it I either have to quit or you know try something else so I went on third shift
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And I worked that shift for eleven years
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Oh my
turns.label: ba

turns.text: Yeah
turns.label: b

turns.text: Bless you
turns.label: o

turns.text: Just so that my kids would have me at home

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: uh-huh

turns.label: sv

turns.text: Yeah I I agree
turns.label: aa

turns.text: And uh I really think that if uh like after the second World War when women went to work in factories and all that that was like out of necessity because the men werent here anymore

turns.text: uh-huh

turns.text: And I notice today kids you know like we had apartments before we had homes
turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And we had to walk before we had car
turns.label: sd

turns.label: sv

turns.text: Oh I know

turns.label: sd

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: We really have - and I Im not trying to be uh you know prude or old fashioned or anything but I I dont think if you unless you earn something and youve worked for it and you have sense of pride about it - because while I did this in you know no one gave it to me
turns.label: sv

turns.text: uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: You will take better care of that and you will prize that possession
turns.label: sv

turns.text: Exactly
turns.label: aa

turns.text: More than someone handing something to you
uh-huh
turns.label: b

turns.text: And its just like college too I think that if kid goes to college and you can help them fine but I dont think you should pay the whole way
turns.label: sv

turns.text: See yeah see now my parents there is no way they could afford to send twelve kids to college
turns.label: b

turns.text: Of course
turns.label: aa

turns.text: And so far there is only two of us that have gone and my older brother has paid his entire way and Im on my - I have six weeks left and Ill you know Ill graduate and I paid my entire way and thats the way itll go down the line and like I dont have car because Im paying for college and if I want car - my parents always said if we wanted car we paid for the car and we paid for our own insurance and I think thats right because -
turns.label: sd

turns.text: Sure but Ill bet your values are lot higher you know and your self esteem and the the way you uh you know think about things is probably --
turns.label: b

turns.label: b

Yeah
turns.label: b

uh-huh Like Ive had my you know - like I know kids up here that have their own cars and money is just given to them like they still get their allowance they are twenty years old and they still get an allowance Well I have held summer job you know since I you know I was in the eleventh grade and I have had to take care of my own money I have my own checking account I pay for my own life insurance and I know lot of kids that dont even know - I mean I tell them I pay for my own life insurance and their mouths just drop to the floor you know
turns.label: b

turns.label: b
